turns.speaker: CHERLINDREA
turns.text: The way has been lost in time. But there is one person, a druid sor- ceress, who might guide you there. She was exiled by Queen Bavmorda many years ago.  Her name is Fin Raziel.

turns.speaker: WILLOW
turns.text: You need a warrior for this job. I'm nobody.

turns.speaker: WILLOW
turns.text: No I'm not.  Have you really looked at me?  I'm short!  Even for a Nelwyn!

turns.speaker: WILLOW
turns.text: Why can't you do it?  You have mag- ical powers.

turns.speaker: CHERLINDREA
turns.text: My prsence cannot extend beyond this forest.  But I can give you these...

turns.speaker: CHERLINDREA
turns.text: Anything you hurl them at will turn to stone.

turns.speaker: WILLOW
turns.text: Sir!  I have to talk to you.

turns.speaker: WILLOW
turns.text: It's a matter of great importance to me!

turns.speaker: HIGH ALDWIN
turns.text: Earlier today you tried to tell me something, Willow.

turns.speaker: WILLOW
turns.text: My family found this baby in the river, High Aldwin.

turns.speaker: HIGH ALDWIN
turns.text: Now, you know where you're going?  Down there, through those trees, follow the river.  You'll know the crossroads by a big daikini struc- ture.  Willow, this is serious business.  Don't waste any time, the outer world is no place for a Nelwyn.  Give the baby to the first daikini you see, then hurry home as fast as you can.

turns.speaker: WILLOW
turns.text: If I'm not strong enough to be your apprentice, how can I do this?

turns.speaker: HIGH ALDWIN
turns.text: You're strong enough.  But you're going to need courage, Willow.

turns.speaker: WILLOW
turns.text: I don't want courage.  I don't want to be a warrior.  All I've ever wanted was to do magic, real magic, like you!

turns.speaker: HIGH ALDWIN
turns.text: Real magic, Willow, is simply the art of controlling the reality of others.  You lack faith in your- self.  You must learn to trust your intuition.

turns.speaker: HIGH ALDWIN
turns.text: Go in the direction the bird is flying.

turns.speaker: WILLOW
turns.text: Oh, if I could do that I'd--I'd turn Burglekutt into a toad!

turns.speaker: HIGH ALDWIN
turns.text: Waste magic on revenge?  You have much to learn, Willow...

turns.speaker: SORSHA
turns.text: You!  Are you the mother of that child?

turns.speaker: MADMARTIGAN
turns.text: Mmmm, I love the smell of a woman.

turns.speaker: SORSHA
turns.text: My step-father's going to tear you apart.

turns.speaker: MADMARTIGAN
turns.text: Too bad you're not more like your father.

turns.speaker: SORSHA
turns.text: You're a fool.  Now put her back.

turns.speaker: MADMARTIGAN
turns.text: I'm not going to let this baby die.

turns.speaker: MADMARTIGAN
turns.text: Willow, why don't you use your mag- ic to get us out of here?

turns.speaker: MADMARTIGAN
turns.text: He turned that monster into stone!

turns.speaker: MADMARTIGAN
turns.text: Then you get us out of here.

turns.speaker: RAZIEL
turns.text: I will!  But I need help!

turns.speaker: MADMARTIGAN
turns.text: We're a tiny version of all that?

turns.speaker: RAZIEL
turns.text: Bavmorda cannot transform you. I've protected this camp with a spell.

turns.speaker: MADMARTIGAN
turns.text: Can you use your magic to get our men into the fortress, Raziel?

turns.speaker: MADMARTIGAN
turns.text: Please?  I'm dyin' of thirst in here.

turns.speaker: WILLOW
turns.text: Good.  How long will it take?

turns.speaker: WILLOW
turns.text: You be careful.  I'm a powerful sorcerer.  I could turn you into a toad just like that.

turns.speaker: WILLOW
turns.text: Do any other daikinis ever come by here?

turns.speaker: WILLOW
turns.text: I have to give this baby to some- body.

turns.speaker: MADMARTIGAN
turns.text: As if you care.  I saved your life, Peck.  Those guys woulda killed us!  You wanna give your baby to them?? They eat babies!

turns.speaker: MADMARTIGAN
turns.text: Farmer!  I knew it!  You're a vic- tim, Willow.  Yep, you and me: victims of a rotten, corrupt, cor- rupt, rotten world.

turns.speaker: MADMARTIGAN
turns.text: The greatest swordsman that ever lived.

turns.speaker: MADMARTIGAN
turns.text: I'll be around long after you're dead, Airk!  You slime!  When I get outa here I'll cut your head off and stick it on a pig-pole!

turns.speaker: MADMARTIGAN
turns.text: Nobody's gonna take your baby. Know why?  Nobody cares...  Except me.  You wanna go back to your farm. You wanna go back to your family. I could take care of that baby. I'll look after her like she was me own.

turns.speaker: WILLOW
turns.text: You don't know anything about ba- bies.

turns.speaker: WILLOW
turns.text: You gotta promise to feed her.

turns.speaker: WILLOW
turns.text: And give her a bath everyday, and don't let her get cold.  And keep her diaper changed.

turns.speaker: WILLOW
turns.text: Here are her diaper rags.  And this is her milk bladder.  And when she cries--she's either hungry or she's tired--rock her on your left shoulder.  She likes that.

turns.speaker: MADMARTIGAN
turns.text: Don't worry, Willow.  She's in good hands.  You haven't made a mistake.

turns.speaker: MADMARTIGAN
turns.text: Where the hell did you come from?

turns.speaker: MADMARTIGAN
turns.text: These Pecks make terrible nurse- maids.

turns.speaker: MADMARTIGAN
turns.text: Now Willow, I know you're gonna blame me for this but it wasn't my fault...!

turns.speaker: MADMARTIGAN
turns.text: When I left the crossroads, I got ambushed by an elf!

turns.speaker: MADMARTIGAN
turns.text: So you're on your way to Tir Asleen, huh?  I hate to tell you this, Willow, but Tir Asleen dosn't exist.

turns.speaker: WILLOW
turns.text: Yes it does.  The Fairy Queen told me.

turns.speaker: MADMARTIGAN
turns.text: The Fairy Queen?  And the baby here's a princess?  And these two rodents are your guides?

turns.speaker: MADMARTIGAN
turns.text: My help?  A great magician like you?  You don't need any help.

turns.speaker: MADMARTIGAN
turns.text: I was in love once, Willow.  She had a hold on my heart.  I could barely function.  I *was* a great swordsman!  I was knighted!  I could have been king!

turns.speaker: MADMARTIGAN
turns.text: Yeah me.  King!  But she betrayed me.  She robbed me of my dream.

turns.speaker: MADMARTIGAN
turns.text: I'm beginning to think you two *deserve* to be locked up.

turns.speaker: WILLOW
turns.text: The universe is a living creature, like you and me, Madmartigan.

turns.speaker: MADMARTIGAN
turns.text: Come on, Peck, don't give me a hard time.  You were in her ten all night.  Did she say anything?

turns.speaker: WILLOW
turns.text: You're crazy.  I think you're in love.

turns.speaker: MADMARTIGAN
turns.text: What are you gonna become, Raziel? Queen of the rodents?

turns.speaker: WILLOW
turns.text: Madmartigan!  I can't stand being in closed-in places.

turns.speaker: WILLOW
turns.text: I'm used to her.  How's she doing?

turns.speaker: MADMARTIGAN
turns.text: Willow...this may be a bad time to ask this question but...what if Raziel's wrong?

turns.speaker: WILLOW
turns.text: She can't be wrong.  She's a very very very powerful sorceress.

turns.speaker: WILLOW
turns.text: That's my fault, not hers.  I've got to keep practicing.  I'm still in the learning stage but magic, Madmartigan, requires concentration and--

turns.speaker: WILLOW
turns.text: I have an idea.  Back in my village we catch a lot of hedgehogs.

turns.speaker: MADMARTIGAN
turns.text: Willow, this is war, not agricul- ture!

turns.speaker: WILLOW
turns.text: I know, I know!  But this is a way to get into that castle...

turns.speaker: WILLOW
turns.text: Madmartigan, you promised me you'd take care of Elora Danan like your own daughter.  She is all that matters.  Are you going to abandon her?

turns.speaker: WILLOW
turns.text: No, it's too big to be a Nelwyn baby.  It looks like a daikini...

turns.speaker: WILLOW
turns.text: Daikinis are giant people who live far far away.

turns.speaker: RANON
turns.text: I could be you rguard!  I could carry your spear!

turns.speaker: WILLOW
turns.text: What a great son you are, Ranon.  I wish I could take you with me.  Now go to sleep...

turns.speaker: RAZIEL
turns.text: Who are you!  Who are you!

turns.speaker: WILLOW
turns.text: I'm Willow Ufgood.  I'm here to find Fin Raziel.

turns.speaker: WILLOW
turns.text: We need your help.  To take this baby to Tir Asleen.  She's a prin- cess.

turns.speaker: RAZIEL
turns.text: Did *you* give that acorn its power?

turns.speaker: RAZIEL
turns.text: A magician *makes* magic.  Any fool can use it.

turns.speaker: RAZIEL
turns.text: Willow.  To learn magic, first you must make your own philosopher's stone!

turns.speaker: WILLOW
turns.text: What do I need for that?

turns.speaker: RAZIEL
turns.text: We must start with feathers, dung, and a lock of your hair.

turns.speaker: WILLOW
turns.text: I hope she's all right.  How much more do I have to do of this?

turns.speaker: RAZIEL
turns.text: Till it's in a powder.  The energy exits within you...

turns.speaker: WILLOW
turns.text: I know, and the magician's goal is to find his true self.  But what's this got to do with it?

turns.speaker: RAZIEL
turns.text: As below, so above.  You hold the univers, Willow, in your hand.

turns.speaker: RAZIEL
turns.text: Burn it to a fine ash.

turns.speaker: WILLOW
turns.text: How am I gonna do that?

turns.speaker: RAZIEL
turns.text: Patience.  Concentrate.  You will find a way.

turns.speaker: RAZIEL
turns.text: We don't have much time left!  Go on!  Go on!

turns.speaker: WILLOW
turns.text: I must concetrate my imagination...to creat a new...reality!

turns.speaker: RAZIEL
turns.text: Your will!  Your will!  What else could it be?

turns.speaker: WILLOW
turns.text: I can't remember all these things. What am I learning?

turns.speaker: WILLOW
turns.text: But what am I gonna transform??

turns.speaker: RAZIEL
turns.text: That's the life spark.  Exxence of magic and sorcery!

turns.speaker: RAZIEL
turns.text: We need blood.  To nourish the stone.  charge the stone with ener- gy.

turns.speaker: RAZIEL
turns.text: Again:  what is the magician's weapon?

turns.speaker: WILLOW
turns.text: I just wanted to test it first.

turns.speaker: RAZIEL
turns.text: No!  Change me back into a sor- ceress, Willow.

turns.speaker: RAZIEL
turns.text: Use the philosopher's stone!  Hur- ry!  Invocation!  Release them!

turns.speaker: WILLOW
turns.text: I did it!  Madmartigan!  Come here! Look!  You gotta see this!  I did it!

turns.speaker: WILLOW
turns.text: Raziel!  I transformed them all! I'm a magician!

turns.speaker: RAZIEL
turns.text: You didn't transform them, Willow, you released them.  That was noth- ing.  Now change me.

turns.speaker: RAZIEL
turns.text: Get down!  The ritual chant! Quick!  Protect yourself!

turns.speaker: WILLOW
turns.text: I've come all this way and now Elora Dana's going to die!

turns.speaker: RAZIEL
turns.text: No!  I can still defeat Bavmorda!

turns.speaker: TEEMO
turns.text: Elves!  They're always tormenting babies.  They make them cry and take their tears.

turns.speaker: TEEMO
turns.text: Watch this.  Right between the eyes.

turns.speaker: ROOL
turns.text: Yes!  Raziel!  She lives out on that island!

turns.speaker: ROOL
turns.text: Us??  We'll never catch them.  Any- way, we're all done, Teemo.  Let's go home.

turns.speaker: WILLOW
turns.text: If you rest the baby on your shoulder, she'll stop crying.

turns.speaker: WILLOW
turns.text: She needs to be changed again. Sorsha crosses her arms in a hugg and watches as Willow changes the baby.  Soon the baby stops crying.  Re- lieved yet still anxious, Sorsha paces to a mirror. Willow rocks the baby gently, absently looking at the fire.  Then his eyes focus on the fire.

turns.speaker: SORSHA
turns.text: Who is that horrible friend of yours?

turns.speaker: WILLOW
turns.text: I don't know much about him.

turns.speaker: SORSHA
turns.text: I know she's hungry.  I tried to feed her but she wouldn't eat a thing.  I'm not a wet nurse.

turns.speaker: TEEMO
turns.text: We are emissaries of her majesty, Queen Cherlindrea, of the land of Coshairm.

turns.speaker: TEEMO
turns.text: She requests the presence of your- self and the young princess.

turns.speaker: WILLOW
turns.text: I'm getting her out of there!

turns.speaker: TEEMO
turns.text: No!  You let us handle this.  Come along, Rool!
